sorular.soru: Does fatigue enhance the adverse effects of alcohol?

feedback.metin: Even after consuming one glass of beer or another alcoholic beverage, your driving skills will be negatively affected. This effect is even further enhanced when you are tired.

sorular.soru: What should you do in this situation?
cevaplar: Slow down and drive into the verge as slowly as possible.
Drive as fast as possible so that the police car can also go faster.
Keep driving at the allowed speed limit.
sorular.dogruCevap: Keep driving at the allowed speed limit.

feedback.metin: You may not violate any traffic rules by exceeding the speed limit and you must not endanger yourself by driving into the verge. Keep driving in your own lane and keep driving at the same speed. The police car will wait for a safe place to overtake.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to stop here?

feedback.metin: The E-2 sign indicates that you are not allowed to stop on this side of the road. However, this does not apply to parking spaces. If, like here, there are parking spaces on the side of the road where the E-2 sign is placed, you may park in those spaces.

sorular.soru: Who are not allowed to cut through a military convoy?

feedback.metin: Road users, i.e. both drivers and pedestrians, are not allowed to cut through a military convoy. If the first vehicle of a convoy has started to cross an equivalent intersection or intersection with traffic lights, you must give way to the rest of the convoy. This also applies if the convoy has started to turn off, or enters or exits an entrance or exit. As a pedestrian, you must wait to cross, even at a pedestrian crossing, if the first vehicle has passed you.

sorular.soru: Do you have right of way here?

feedback.metin: The traffic light has the shape of a circle, not an arrow, which means oncoming traffic may have a green light at the same time as you. The rule that right-turn traffic precedes left-turn traffic continues to apply here. The black vehicle is turning right and therefore has right of way.

sorular.soru: What does this symbol indicate?
cevaplar: The rear window heater is enabled.
sorular.dogruCevap: The rear window heater is enabled.

feedback.metin: This symbol indicates that the rear window heating is on. Make sure that you switch off the rear window heating as soon as the rear window is defogged or defrosted. This prevents unnecessary energy consumption. In some passenger cars, this heating switches off automatically after a while.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here?

feedback.metin: Within an erf, parking is only allowed in the designated parking space. You are parked outside of a parking space, which is prohibited.

sorular.soru: What should you do when the vehicle windscreen is fogged on the inside?
cevaplar: Clean the windows with a cloth, then start driving.
Defog the windows with the blower, then start driving.
Start driving slowly. Windows demist more quickly when the vehicle is moving.
sorular.dogruCevap: Defog the windows with the blower, then start driving.

feedback.metin: Driving with a fogged or frozen windscreen is prohibited due to the impact on visibility. Put the vehicle on contact and turn on the blower and air conditioning (if applicable). Do not wipe the windows with a cloth or your sleeves as this will cause streaking on the windows, impacting visibility. Do not start driving until the windows are clean.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to overtake the bus?

feedback.metin: You can overtake a bus leaving a bus stop, but not if there is oncoming traffic.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive like this?

feedback.metin: You are not allowed to drive like this if the cap of the lamp is broken or missing. Even if the lamp itself emits the right colour.

sorular.soru: When should you indicate if you want to turn off in a built-up area?

feedback.metin: Indicating your intended movements helps improve traffic flow. In built-up areas, you indicate 100 metres before turning off. On roads outside of built-up areas and on autowegen you indicate 200 metres in advance. On motorways, you indicate 300 metres before you turn off.

sorular.soru: Should you use sidelights and rear lights at night when parking on a carriageway outside a built-up area?

feedback.metin: At night and during the day, when visibility is seriously obstructed, you are not allowed to park on a carriageway outside a built-up area or wait without lighting. In this case, you must use side- and rear lights. This obligation also applies to parking and waiting on parking lanes, car parks, hard shoulders and lay-bys located along autowegen and motorways.

sorular.soru: What should you expect here?
cevaplar: That a second train can pass after the first one in the opposite direction.
That the traffic approaching from behind may not notice you in time.
That you can continue driving as soon as the barriers go up.
sorular.dogruCevap: That a second train can pass after the first one in the opposite direction.

feedback.metin: The double Andreas crosses (sign J-13) show that this is a level crossing with two or more tracks. This means that after passing the first train, a second one can always follow in the opposite direction. In that case, the barriers can first go up, after which they immediately go down again. Always wait until the red lights are off before you drive.

sorular.soru: What colour of retro-reflectors can you find on the front of a trailer?

feedback.metin: At the rear of a trailer, you will always find red retro-reflectors. In many cases, the red retro-reflectors at the rear are triangular. This is not mandatory in the Netherlands, but it is in some other countries. Amber retro-reflectors can be found on the sides of a trailer. At the front of the trailer, you will find white retro-reflectors.

sorular.soru: How should this situation be resolved?
cevaplar: The fastest vehicle has right of way.
The police vehicle always has right of way.
Together you determine who goes first.
sorular.dogruCevap: Together you determine who goes first.

feedback.metin: There is an obstacle on both sides and so there is no arrangement as to who can go first. Here you have to solve the problem of who goes first. Usually, this is the vehicle that arrives first, but when you arrive at the same time, you communicate right of way by means of eye contact and hand gestures. Because the police vehicle is not using any optical or sound signals, it is not an emergency (priority) vehicle and is equal to you.

sorular.soru: Up to what height should children use a seat booster?

feedback.metin: Children less than 1.35 metres tall must use a seat booster.

sorular.soru: How long can you stop at a bus stop to pick up or drop off a passenger?
cevaplar: Only for the time necessary to get in or out of the car.
You are not allowed to pick up or drop off passengers at bus stops.
sorular.dogruCevap: Only for the time necessary to get in or out of the car.

feedback.metin: At a bus stop, you may not stop next to the block marking. If this block marking is missing, you may not stop within a distance of 12 metres from the bus stop sign. However, you may stop to pick up or drop off a bus passenger. There is no specific time for this, but it may not take longer than necessary. You may not wait for a passenger and must leave immediately after the passenger got in or out.

sorular.soru: Is a car required to have pneumatic tyres?

feedback.metin: A passenger car must be equipped with pneumatic tyres. These tyres may be filled with nitrogen instead of air. All other tyres, such as solid rubber tyres or tracks, are prohibited.

sorular.soru: Who is allowed to go first?

feedback.metin: If two drivers would like to enter the same road, the driver turning right goes first. Short turns have right of way over long turns.

sorular.soru: What is the speed limit after this combination of signs?

feedback.metin: A bicycle street is a street that is laid out as a bicycle route, with the goal of making bicycle traffic safer. However, this combination of signs holds no legal weight and there are no deviating traffic rules. This means the speed limit for motorists here is 50 km/h, which – although permitted by law – is clearly not the intention. This is why most bicycle streets have a 30 km/h zone sign. However, this is not always the case.

sorular.soru: When should a car that runs on diesel be inspected for the first time?

feedback.metin: Cars that run on diesel, gas or hydrogen (possibly in combination with an electric motor) must be inspected for the first time after 3 years and annually afterwards.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to drive on?

feedback.metin: A military convoy that has started to cross an intersection at a green light may continue if the traffic light changes to yellow and then red. Other drivers may not cut through the convoy, even if they have a green light. You must wait for the convoy; you cannot start driving. Road signs such as priority triangles and the 'priority road' sign only apply when the traffic lights are not working. When functioning, traffic lights prevail over traffic signs and signs governing right of way.

sorular.soru: Do the road surface, the tyres and the braking deceleration all influence the braking distance?

feedback.metin: The braking distance is the distance required to come to a standstill from the moment the brake is applied. The road surface, the quality of the tyres and the deceleration of your vehicle all influence the braking distance. A poor road surface, bad tyres and a low deceleration (less than 5.2 m per second squared) will all have a negative influence on the braking distance.

sorular.soru: Can you brake lightly in order to deter the tailgater?

feedback.metin: Never let yourself be rushed and always stay calm. Keep sufficient distance from the vehicle in front of you. Make room as soon as this is possible and safe. Never apply the brake to warn a tailgater. This can lead to serious accidents for which you are held liable because you have unnecessarily endangered other road users.

sorular.soru: How many adult passengers are allowed to sit here?

feedback.metin: This rear seat is equipped with three seat belts. This means that three passengers are allowed to sit here.

sorular.soru: How do you transport a child under 12 years of age and less than 1.35 metres tall in the front seat as safely as possible?
cevaplar: In a child restraint system, passenger airbag off.
In the three-point belt, passenger airbag off.
In a child restraint system, always put passenger airbag on.
sorular.dogruCevap: In a child restraint system, passenger airbag off.

feedback.metin: If you are transporting a child under the age of 12, they should be seated in a child restraint system on the back seat. If the child can only be seated on the front seat, the child restraint system should still be used. The passenger airbag should also be disabled. This is not mandatory, but it is safer in most cases. Front airbags are designed for adult passengers and are far too powerful for a young child.

sorular.soru: Can you park here?

feedback.metin: The E-4 sign is placed at the beginning of a lay-by, a parking strip, or at the entrance to a car park. This sign indicates that you can park here.

sorular.soru: What should you do in the event of sudden heavy rain?
cevaplar: Reduce speed and switch off cruise control.
Reduce speed and turn off ESP.
Reduce speed and activate cruise control.
sorular.dogruCevap: Reduce speed and switch off cruise control.

feedback.metin: If it suddenly begins to rain heavily, you must be aware of potential slipperiness. Reducing your speed and turning off cruise control is therefore the best course of action. Cruise control must be switched off before you can intervene should your vehicle begin to slip, wasting valuable time before you can react. ESP helps prevent slipping, so turning this off in heavy rain is not recommended.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to park here without a disabled parking permit if your passenger has his leg in a cast?

feedback.metin: Parking on a disabled parking space with your passenger car is only allowed if you or your passenger has a disabled parking permit. Even if your passenger visibly cannot walk properly, you are not allowed to park here. However, you may let the passenger get out if you drive off yourself afterwards.

sorular.soru: Are you allowed to ride a bicycle while forbidden to drive?

feedback.metin: If you have been deemed forbidden to drive, you may not operate any vehicle at all for a certain length of time. This includes bicycles. You may be forbidden to drive if you have been caught operating a vehicle under the influence of drugs or excessive alcohol. This ban takes effect immediately and for a maximum of 24 hours. It is different from a driving licence suspension – if your driving licence is suspended, you cannot operate any vehicle for which a driving licence is required. In that case, cycling would still be permitted.

sorular.soru: Which driving licence do you need to drive a motor vehicle with a maximum authorised mass of more than 3500 kg?

feedback.metin: To drive a motor vehicle with a maximum authorised mass of more than 3500 kg, you need driving licence C. Driving licence B is for motor vehicles with a maximum authorised mass of up to 3500 kg. Driving licence D is for motor vehicles carrying more than 8 persons excluding the driver.

sorular.soru: What should you do first if you are involved in an accident in which a victim looks injured?

feedback.metin: If you are involved in an accident, you must first ensure your own safety. Even when providing assistance, you should always check whether it is safe to do so. If you have determined that someone is in need of help, you must first warn the emergency services and directly after that help the victim within your capabilities.

sorular.soru: You have a technical problem with your vehicle. Are you allowed to stop here?

feedback.metin: Using the hard shoulder, lay-bys, or verges on autowegen and motorways is prohibited except in case of emergencies. A technical malfunction in your vehicle does qualify as an emergency situation.

sorular.soru: After which sign should you expect oncoming traffic?

feedback.metin: The F-5 sign indicates that you must give way to oncoming traffic. The J-29 sign warns you of oncoming traffic. After both signs you must expect oncoming traffic.

sorular.soru: In which scenario does the tractor have right of way?

feedback.metin: You are leaving via an exit construction and must therefore give way to all other traffic. The “short turn goes before long turn” rule does not apply in this case. In both scenarios, the tractor has right of way.
